    • Data Structures for Bipartite Record Linkage

    Check that graph is a bipartite weighted graph.

    isBipartiteWeightedGraph.Rd

    A bipartite weighted graph is a bipartite graph with edge weights.

    isBipartiteWeightedGraph(graph, n1, n2)

    Arguments

    graph

    object check.

    n1

    size of the first list of records.

    n2

    size of the second list of records.

    Value

    TRUE if graph is a bipartite weighted graph, FALSE otherwise.

    Examples

    graph <- igraph::graph.bipartite(types=c(rep(TRUE, 3), rep(FALSE, 2)), edges = c(1, 4, 3, 5), directed = FALSE)
igraph::E(graph)$weight = c(1.5, 0.5)
n1 <- 3
n2 <- 2
isBipartiteWeightedGraph(graph, n1, n2)
#> [1] TRUE
# Returns: TRUE

graph[]
#> 5 x 5 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"
#>                       
#> [1,] .   . .   1.5 .  
#> [2,] .   . .   .   .  
#> [3,] .   . .   .   0.5
#> [4,] 1.5 . .   .   .  
#> [5,] .   . 0.5 .   .  
# 5 x 5 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"
# 
# [1,] .   . .   1.5 .  
# [2,] .   . .   .   .  
# [3,] .   . .   .   0.5
# [4,] 1.5 . .   .   .  
# [5,] .   . 0.5 .   .
